entry.title: Saturday: Flurries or snow squalls. Temperature falling to minus 15 this afternoon.
entry.summary: Flurries or snow squalls. Blowing snow. Local amount 5 cm except 15 cm north of Marystown. Wind southwest 60 km/h gusting to 80 except gusting to 100 over exposed areas. Temperature falling to minus 15 this afternoon. Wind chill near minus 30. Risk of frostbite. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Saturday 04 February 2023

entry.title: Saturday night: Flurries or snow squalls. Temperature rising to minus 6 by morning.
entry.summary: Flurries or snow squalls ending near midnight then partly cloudy with 40 percent chance of flurries. Blowing snow. Local amount 2 to 4 cm. Wind southwest 60 km/h gusting to 80 except gusting to 100 over exposed areas this evening. Wind becoming northwest 50 gusting to 70 near midnight. Temperature rising to minus 6 by morning. Wind chill minus 25 this evening and minus 16 overnight. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Saturday 04 February 2023

entry.title: Sunday: Flurries. Temperature steady near minus 6.
entry.summary: Flurries with risk of snow squalls. Blowing snow over exposed areas. Local amount 2 cm. Wind northwest 40 km/h gusting to 60 becoming southwest 30 gusting to 50 near noon. Temperature steady near minus 6. Wind chill near minus 17. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Saturday 04 February 2023
